title: Ticket #5037: Restructure Callbacks and event handling
description:
Event Handling

It has long been true that any event which did not have a call back would cause a failure. There was no method to preset events as expected and ok. So now there is a call to allow events and another one to clear them. 

Condor::SetAllowedEvents("RegisterEvictedWithoutCheckpoint,RegisterSubmit,RegisterExecute,RegisterAbort");

This makes the events legal and bypassed until removed with ClearAllowedEvents. When an event happens a routine called CheckAllowed looks to see if the event is registered and if so no failure is declared. More on this in the Call back changes.

Call Back Changes

  1. It used to be that we reset the test module on every call to RunTest RunTestDag and SimpleJob::RunCheck. Set events and callbacks now only clear from an explicite call to Condor::EventReset. Ending the test will remove the impact on any event or callback. This persistenceof the new allowed events and callbacks is a very substantial change.
  2. Since so much is done the SimpleJob:RunCheck including multiple uses per test, The module had to have memory of set callbacks so that a second call to RunCheck would know this. The routine which lears events remembered in SimpleJob.pm is SimpleJob::CallbackReset.
  3. You may reset any callback by passing a new handler. Runcheck at the beginning will over ride saved handlers if a new one is passed in.
  4. The RegisteredTimed callback had conflicting usage from tests and from SimpleJob::RunCheck. The Condor.pm module now wathches the use of this timer and unless it is reset by a test which already has the timer. NOTE the timer is a callback and as such make sure you remove it at the right time or it might fire after you had moved on.
  5. SimpleJob::Runcheck will now get it's own timer
  6. Daemon log searching tools in Check::CondorLog.pm needs their own timer too or we will loose callbacks.
